verses.verse: Even to day<WH3117> is my complaint<WH7879> bitter<WH4805>: my stroke<WH3027> is heavier<WH3513> than my groaning<WH585>.
Oh that<WH5414> I knew<WH3045> where I might find<WH4672> him! that I might come<WH935> even to his seat<WH8499>!
I would order<WH6186> my cause<WH4941> before<WH6440> him, and fill<WH4390> my mouth<WH6310> with arguments<WH8433>.
I would know<WH3045> the words<WH4405> which he would answer<WH6030> me, and understand<WH995> what he would say<WH559> unto me.
Will he plead<WH7378> against<WH5978> me with his great<WH7230> power<WH3581>? No; but he would put<WH7760> strength in me.
There the righteous<WH3477> might dispute<WH3198> with him; so should I be delivered<WH6403> for ever<WH5331> from my judge<WH8199>.
Behold, I go<WH1980> forward<WH6924>, but he is not there; and backward<WH268>, but I cannot perceive<WH995> him:
On the left hand<WH8040>, where he doth work<WH6213>, but I cannot behold<WH2372> him: he hideth<WH5848> himself on the right hand<WH3225>, that I cannot see<WH7200> him:
But he knoweth<WH3045> the way<WH1870> that I take<WH5978>: when he hath tried<WH974> me, I shall come forth<WH3318> as gold<WH2091>.
My foot<WH7272> hath held<WH270> his steps<WH838>, his way<WH1870> have I kept<WH8104>, and not declined<WH5186>.
Neither have I gone back<WH4185> from the commandment<WH4687> of his lips<WH8193>; I have esteemed<WH6845> the words<WH561> of his mouth<WH6310> more than my necessary<WH2706> food.
But he is in one<WH259> mind, and who can turn<WH7725> him? and what his soul<WH5315> desireth<WH183>, even that he doeth<WH6213>.
For he performeth<WH7999> the thing that is appointed<WH2706> for me: and many<WH7227> such<WH2007> things are with him.
Therefore am I troubled<WH926> at his presence<WH6440>: when I consider<WH995>, I am afraid<WH6342> of him.
For God<WH410> maketh my heart<WH3820> soft<WH7401>, and the Almighty<WH7706> troubleth<WH926> me:
Because I was not cut off<WH6789> before<WH6440> the darkness<WH2822>, neither hath he covered<WH3680> the darkness<WH652> from my face<WH6440>.
